title: Publius Valerius Publicola celebrates the first triumph of the Roman Republic after his victory over the deposed king Lucius Tarquinius Superbus at the Battle of Silva Arsia.
text: Publius Valerius Publicola celebrates the first triumph of the Roman Republic after his victory over the deposed king Lucius Tarquinius Superbus at the Battle of Silva Arsia.

title: Lucius Cornelius Sulla, at the head of a Roman Republic army, enters Athens, removing the tyrant Aristion who was supported by troops of Mithridates VI of Pontus ending the Siege of Athens and Piraeus.
text: Lucius Cornelius Sulla, at the head of a Roman Republic army, enters Athens, removing the tyrant Aristion who was supported by troops of Mithridates VI of Pontus ending the Siege of Athens and Piraeus.

title: Emperor Diocletian and Maximian appoint Constantius Chlorus and Galerius as Caesars. This is considered the beginning of the Tetrarchy, known as the Quattuor Principes Mundi ("Four Rulers of the World").
text: Emperor Diocletian and Maximian appoint Constantius Chlorus and Galerius as Caesars. This is considered the beginning of the Tetrarchy, known as the Quattuor Principes Mundi ("Four Rulers of the World").

title: Crispus and Constantine II, sons of Roman Emperor Constantine I, and Licinius Iunior, son of Emperor Licinius, are made Caesares.
text: Crispus and Constantine II, sons of Roman Emperor Constantine I, and Licinius Iunior, son of Emperor Licinius, are made Caesares.

title: Vetranio is asked by Constantina, sister of Constantius II, to proclaim himself Caesar.
text: Vetranio is asked by Constantina, sister of Constantius II, to proclaim himself Caesar.

title: Emperor Louis the Pious is restored as sole ruler of the Frankish Empire. After his re-accession to the throne, his eldest son Lothair I flees to Burgundy.
text: Emperor Louis the Pious is restored as sole ruler of the Frankish Empire. After his re-accession to the throne, his eldest son Lothair I flees to Burgundy.

title: The Unitas Fratrum is established in the village of Kunvald, on the Bohemian-Moravian borderland. It is to date the second oldest Protestant denomination.
text: The Unitas Fratrum is established in the village of Kunvald, on the Bohemian-Moravian borderland. It is to date the second oldest Protestant denomination.

title: Forces of the Catholic Monarchs engage the combined Portuguese-Castilian armies of Afonso V and Prince John at the Battle of Toro.
text: Forces of the Catholic Monarchs engage the combined Portuguese-Castilian armies of Afonso V and Prince John at the Battle of Toro.

title: Sixty-three Huguenots are massacred in Wassy, France, marking the start of the French Wars of Religion.
text: Sixty-three Huguenots are massacred in Wassy, France, marking the start of the French Wars of Religion.

title: The city of Rio de Janeiro is founded.
text: The city of Rio de Janeiro is founded.

title: Writs issued in February by Charles I of England mandate that every county in England (not just seaport towns) pay ship tax by this date.
text: Writs issued in February by Charles I of England mandate that every county in England (not just seaport towns) pay ship tax by this date.

title: Samuel de Champlain reclaims his role as commander of New France on behalf of Cardinal Richelieu.
text: Samuel de Champlain reclaims his role as commander of New France on behalf of Cardinal Richelieu.

title: Georgeana, Massachusetts (now known as York, Maine), becomes the first incorporated city in the United States.
text: Georgeana, Massachusetts (now known as York, Maine), becomes the first incorporated city in the United States.

title: Sarah Good, Sarah Osborne and Tituba are brought before local magistrates in Salem Village, Massachusetts, beginning what would become known as the Salem witch trials.
text: Sarah Good, Sarah Osborne and Tituba are brought before local magistrates in Salem Village, Massachusetts, beginning what would become known as the Salem witch trials.

title: Sweden introduces its own Swedish calendar, in an attempt to gradually merge into the Gregorian calendar, reverts to the Julian calendar on this date in 1712, and introduces the Gregorian calendar on this date in 1753.
text: Sweden introduces its own Swedish calendar, in an attempt to gradually merge into the Gregorian calendar, reverts to the Julian calendar on this date in 1712, and introduces the Gregorian calendar on this date in 1753.

title: The siege and destruction of Fort Neoheroka begins during the Tuscarora War in North Carolina, effectively opening up the colony's interior to European colonization.
text: The siege and destruction of Fort Neoheroka begins during the Tuscarora War in North Carolina, effectively opening up the colony's interior to European colonization.

title: The Continental Congress adopts the Articles of Confederation.
text: The Continental Congress adopts the Articles of Confederation.

title: The first United States census is authorized.
text: The first United States census is authorized.

title: French Revolutionary War: Battle of Aldenhoven during the Flanders Campaign.
text: French Revolutionary War: Battle of Aldenhoven during the Flanders Campaign.

title: The Dutch East India Company is nationalized by the Batavian Republic.
text: The Dutch East India Company is nationalized by the Batavian Republic.

title: Justice Samuel Chase is acquitted at the end of his impeachment trial by the U.S. Senate.
text: Justice Samuel Chase is acquitted at the end of his impeachment trial by the U.S. Senate.

title: Leaders of the Mamluk dynasty are killed by Egyptian ruler Muhammad Ali.
text: Leaders of the Mamluk dynasty are killed by Egyptian ruler Muhammad Ali.

title: Napoleon returns to France from his banishment on Elba.
text: Napoleon returns to France from his banishment on Elba.

title: Georgetown University's congressional charter is signed into law by President James Madison.
text: Georgetown University's congressional charter is signed into law by President James Madison.

title: A convention of delegates from 57 Texas communities convenes in Washington-on-the-Brazos, Texas, to deliberate independence from Mexico.
text: A convention of delegates from 57 Texas communities convenes in Washington-on-the-Brazos, Texas, to deliberate independence from Mexico.

title: United States President John Tyler signs a bill authorizing the United States to annex the Republic of Texas.
text: United States President John Tyler signs a bill authorizing the United States to annex the Republic of Texas.

title: Archibald Montgomerie, 13th Earl of Eglinton, is appointed Lord Lieutenant of Ireland.
text: Archibald Montgomerie, 13th Earl of Eglinton, is appointed Lord Lieutenant of Ireland.

title: German psychologist Friedrich Eduard Beneke disappears; two years later his remains are found in a canal near Charlottenburg.
text: German psychologist Friedrich Eduard Beneke disappears; two years later his remains are found in a canal near Charlottenburg.

title: Nebraska becomes the 37th U.S. state; Lancaster, Nebraska is renamed Lincoln and becomes the state capital.
text: Nebraska becomes the 37th U.S. state; Lancaster, Nebraska is renamed Lincoln and becomes the state capital.

title: The Pi Kappa Alpha Fraternity is founded at the University of Virginia.
text: The Pi Kappa Alpha Fraternity is founded at the University of Virginia.

title: Marshal F. S. López dies during the Battle of Cerro Corá thus marking the end of the Paraguayan War.
text: Marshal F. S. López dies during the Battle of Cerro Corá thus marking the end of the Paraguayan War.

title: Yellowstone National Park is established as the world's first national park.
text: Yellowstone National Park is established as the world's first national park.

title: E. Remington and Sons in Ilion, New York begins production of the first practical typewriter.
text: E. Remington and Sons in Ilion, New York begins production of the first practical typewriter.

title: The first Minnesota State Capitol burns down due to a fire.
text: The first Minnesota State Capitol burns down due to a fire.

title: The Anglo-Chinese School, Singapore is founded by Bishop William Oldham.
text: The Anglo-Chinese School, Singapore is founded by Bishop William Oldham.

title: Electrical engineer Nikola Tesla gives the first public demonstration of radio in St. Louis, Missouri.
text: Electrical engineer Nikola Tesla gives the first public demonstration of radio in St. Louis, Missouri.

title: Battle of Adwa: An Ethiopian army defeats an outnumbered Italian force, ending the First Italo-Ethiopian War.
text: Battle of Adwa: An Ethiopian army defeats an outnumbered Italian force, ending the First Italo-Ethiopian War.

title: Henri Becquerel discovers radioactive decay.
text: Henri Becquerel discovers radioactive decay.

title: The Australian Army is formed.
text: The Australian Army is formed.

title: The worst avalanche in United States history buries a Great Northern Railway train in northeastern King County, Washington, killing 96 people.
text: The worst avalanche in United States history buries a Great Northern Railway train in northeastern King County, Washington, killing 96 people.

title: The Republic of China joins the Universal Postal Union.
text: The Republic of China joins the Universal Postal Union.

title: The Zimmermann Telegram is reprinted in newspapers across the United States after the U.S. government releases its unencrypted text.
text: The Zimmermann Telegram is reprinted in newspapers across the United States after the U.S. government releases its unencrypted text.

title: March 1st Movement begins in Korea under Japanese rule.
text: March 1st Movement begins in Korea under Japanese rule.

title: The Australian cricket team captained by Warwick Armstrong becomes the first team to complete a whitewash of The Ashes, something that would not be repeated for 86 years.
text: The Australian cricket team captained by Warwick Armstrong becomes the first team to complete a whitewash of The Ashes, something that would not be repeated for 86 years.

title: Charles Lindbergh's son is reportedly kidnapped.
text: Charles Lindbergh's son is reportedly kidnapped.

title: The Hoover Dam is completed.
text: The Hoover Dam is completed.

title: An Imperial Japanese Army ammunition dump explodes at Hirakata, Osaka, Japan, killing 94.
text: An Imperial Japanese Army ammunition dump explodes at Hirakata, Osaka, Japan, killing 94.

title: World War II: Bulgaria signs the Tripartite Pact, allying itself with the Axis powers.
text: World War II: Bulgaria signs the Tripartite Pact, allying itself with the Axis powers.

title: World War II: Japanese forces land on Java, the main island of the Dutch East Indies, at Merak and Banten Bay (Banten), Eretan Wetan (Indramayu) and Kragan (Rembang).
text: World War II: Japanese forces land on Java, the main island of the Dutch East Indies, at Merak and Banten Bay (Banten), Eretan Wetan (Indramayu) and Kragan (Rembang).

title: The Bank of England is nationalised.
text: The Bank of England is nationalised.

title: The International Monetary Fund begins financial operations.
text: The International Monetary Fund begins financial operations.

title: Indonesian Army recaptures and occupies for six hours its capital city Yogyakarta from the Dutch.
text: Indonesian Army recaptures and occupies for six hours its capital city Yogyakarta from the Dutch.

title: Cold War: Klaus Fuchs is convicted of spying for the Soviet Union by disclosing top secret atomic bomb data.
text: Cold War: Klaus Fuchs is convicted of spying for the Soviet Union by disclosing top secret atomic bomb data.

title: Soviet Premier Joseph Stalin suffers a stroke and collapses; he dies four days later.
text: Soviet Premier Joseph Stalin suffers a stroke and collapses; he dies four days later.

title: Nuclear weapons testing: The Castle Bravo, a 15-megaton hydrogen bomb, is detonated on Bikini Atoll in the Pacific Ocean, resulting in the worst radioactive contamination ever caused by the United States.
text: Nuclear weapons testing: The Castle Bravo, a 15-megaton hydrogen bomb, is detonated on Bikini Atoll in the Pacific Ocean, resulting in the worst radioactive contamination ever caused by the United States.

title: Armed Puerto Rican nationalists attack the United States Capitol building, injuring five Representatives.
text: Armed Puerto Rican nationalists attack the United States Capitol building, injuring five Representatives.

title: The International Air Transport Association finalizes a draft of the Radiotelephony spelling alphabet for the International Civil Aviation Organization.
text: The International Air Transport Association finalizes a draft of the Radiotelephony spelling alphabet for the International Civil Aviation Organization.

title: Formation of the East German Nationale Volksarmee.
text: Formation of the East German Nationale Volksarmee.

title: Samuel Alphonsus Stritch is appointed Pro-Prefect of the Propagation of Faith and thus becomes the first U.S. member of the Roman Curia.
text: Samuel Alphonsus Stritch is appointed Pro-Prefect of the Propagation of Faith and thus becomes the first U.S. member of the Roman Curia.

title: United States President John F. Kennedy establishes the Peace Corps.
text: United States President John F. Kennedy establishes the Peace Corps.

title: Uganda becomes self-governing and holds its first elections.
text: Uganda becomes self-governing and holds its first elections.

title: Villarrica Volcano begins a strombolian eruption causing lahars that destroy half of the town of Coñaripe.
text: Villarrica Volcano begins a strombolian eruption causing lahars that destroy half of the town of Coñaripe.

title: Venera 3 Soviet space probe crashes on Venus becoming the first spacecraft to land on another planet's surface.
text: Venera 3 Soviet space probe crashes on Venus becoming the first spacecraft to land on another planet's surface.

title: The Ba'ath Party takes power in Syria.
text: The Ba'ath Party takes power in Syria.

title: President of Pakistan Yahya Khan indefinitely postpones the pending national assembly session, precipitating massive civil disobedience in East Pakistan.
text: President of Pakistan Yahya Khan indefinitely postpones the pending national assembly session, precipitating massive civil disobedience in East Pakistan.

title: The Thai province of Yasothon is created after being split off from the Ubon Ratchathani Province.
text: The Thai province of Yasothon is created after being split off from the Ubon Ratchathani Province.

title: Black September storms the Saudi embassy in Khartoum, Sudan, resulting in the assassination of three Western hostages.
text: Black September storms the Saudi embassy in Khartoum, Sudan, resulting in the assassination of three Western hostages.

title: Watergate scandal: Seven are indicted for their role in the Watergate break-in and charged with conspiracy to obstruct justice.
text: Watergate scandal: Seven are indicted for their role in the Watergate break-in and charged with conspiracy to obstruct justice.

title: Provisional Irish Republican Army member Bobby Sands begins his hunger strike in HM Prison Maze.
text: Provisional Irish Republican Army member Bobby Sands begins his hunger strike in HM Prison Maze.

title: First collection of twelve Swatch models was introduced in Zürich, Switzerland
text: First collection of twelve Swatch models was introduced in Zürich, Switzerland

title: Steve Jackson Games is raided by the United States Secret Service, prompting the later formation of the Electronic Frontier Foundation.
text: Steve Jackson Games is raided by the United States Secret Service, prompting the later formation of the Electronic Frontier Foundation.

title: Uprisings against Saddam Hussein begin in Iraq, leading to the death of more than 25,000 people mostly civilian.
text: Uprisings against Saddam Hussein begin in Iraq, leading to the death of more than 25,000 people mostly civilian.

title: Bosnia and Herzegovina declares its independence from Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
text: Bosnia and Herzegovina declares its independence from Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.

title: Titanic became the first film to gross over $1 billion worldwide.
text: Titanic became the first film to gross over $1 billion worldwide.

title: U.S. invasion of Afghanistan: Operation Anaconda begins in eastern Afghanistan.
text: U.S. invasion of Afghanistan: Operation Anaconda begins in eastern Afghanistan.

title: The Envisat environmental satellite successfully reaches an orbit 800 kilometers (500 mi) above the Earth on its 11th launch, carrying the heaviest payload to date at 8500 kilograms (8.5 tons).
text: The Envisat environmental satellite successfully reaches an orbit 800 kilometers (500 mi) above the Earth on its 11th launch, carrying the heaviest payload to date at 8500 kilograms (8.5 tons).

title: Management of the United States Customs Service and the United States Secret Service move to the United States Department of Homeland Security.
text: Management of the United States Customs Service and the United States Secret Service move to the United States Department of Homeland Security.

title: The International Criminal Court holds its inaugural session in The Hague.
text: The International Criminal Court holds its inaugural session in The Hague.

title: In Roper v. Simmons, the U.S. Supreme Court rules that the execution of juveniles found guilty of murder is unconstitutional.
text: In Roper v. Simmons, the U.S. Supreme Court rules that the execution of juveniles found guilty of murder is unconstitutional.

title: English-language Wikipedia reaches its one millionth article, Jordanhill railway station.

title: Tornadoes break out across the southern United States, killing at least 20 people, including eight at Enterprise High School.

title: The Armenian police clash with peaceful opposition rally protesting against allegedly fraudulent presidential elections, as a result ten people are killed.
